item.title: 据彭博新闻社报道，史蒂夫-科恩停止为对冲基金 Point72 进行交易
item.description: 据彭博新闻社周二报道，对冲基金 Point72 资产管理公司的创始人、亿万富翁史蒂夫-科恩（Steve Cohen）已退出交易大厅，将专注于推动公司的发展。【原文：Steve Cohen, billionaire and founder of hedge fund Point72 Asset Management, has stepped away from the trading floor and will focus on driving the firm's growth, Bloomberg News reported on Tuesday.】

item.title: 英国《金融时报》报道：微软和贝莱德计划成立 300 亿美元基金，投资人工智能基础设施
item.description: 英国《金融时报》周二援引知情人士的话报道称，贝莱德正准备与微软共同发起一个规模超过 300 亿美元的人工智能投资基金，用于建设数据中心和能源项目，以满足人工智能带来的日益增长的需求。【原文：BlackRock is preparing to launch a more than $30 billion artificial intelligence investment fund with Microsoft to build data centers and energy projects to meet growing demands stemming from AI, the Financial Times reported on Tuesday, citing people briefed about the matter.】

item.title: 独家报道：备忘录称，激进分子埃利奥特告诉西南航空的机械师，它仍希望首席执行官下台
item.description: 根据路透社看到的一份工会备忘录，激进投资者埃利奥特投资管理公司（Elliott Investment Management）告诉西南航空公司的一个高层工会，即使在该航空公司承诺调整董事会之后，它仍然希望更换首席执行官罗伯特-乔丹（Robert Jordan）。【原文：Activist investor Elliott Investment Management told one of Southwest Airlines' top unions it still wants to replace CEO Robert Jordan, according to a union memo seen by Reuters, even after the carrier pledged to shake up its board.】

item.title: EA 对年度预订充满信心，宣布推出《战地》新作
item.description: 电子游戏发行商电子艺界（Electronic Arts）在周二举行的投资者日会议上表示，预计将实现其年度预订额预测的高端目标，并推出了多人射击游戏《战地》的下一版。【原文：Videogame publisher Electronic Arts said it expects to achieve the high end of its annual bookings forecast and unveiled the next installment of its multi-player shooter game "Battlefield" at its investor day conference on Tuesday.】

item.title: 马斯克的 Neuralink 公司因植入大脑而获得美国食品及药物管理局的突破性设备标签
item.description: 埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）的脑芯片初创公司 Neuralink 周二表示，其植入物已获得美国食品和药物管理局的 "突破性设备 "称号。【原文：Elon Musk's brain-chip startup Neuralink said on Tuesday its implant had received the U.S. Food and Drug Administration's "breakthrough device" designation.】

item.title: 独家报道油价低迷，美国将寻求600万桶石油储备
item.description: 一位熟知此事的消息人士周二表示，拜登政府将为战略石油储备寻求多达 600 万桶石油，如果这一采购计划得以完成，将是继 2022 年历史性出售石油之后最大的一次石油储备补充。【原文：The Biden administration will seek up to 6 million barrels of oil for the Strategic Petroleum Reserve, a source familiar with issue said on Tuesday, a purchase that if completed will match its largest yet in the replenishment of the stash after a historic sale in 2022.】

item.title: 运输部称阿拉斯加航空和夏威夷航空可完成合并交易
item.description: 美国交通部周二表示，在双方同意保留夏威夷的主要航线并采取消费者保护措施后，美国交通部已同意允许阿拉斯加航空公司以 19 亿美元的价格完成对夏威夷航空公司的收购。【原文：The U.S. Transportation Department said on Tuesday it had agreed to allow Alaska Airlines to close on its $1.9 billion acquisition of Hawaiian Airlines , after the carriers agreed to maintain key Hawaiian routes and adopt consumer protections.】

item.title: FTX 审计师就美国证券交易委员会失职案达成和解并支付罚款
item.description: FTX 的一名前审计师将支付 195 万美元，以了结美国证券交易委员会的两起案件，包括因涉嫌在审计山姆-班克曼-弗里德（Sam Bankman-Fried）领导的加密货币交易所时玩忽职守而被判定犯有欺诈罪。【原文：A former auditor for FTX will pay $1.95 million to settle two U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission cases, including for alleged negligence in auditing the cryptocurrency exchange Sam Bankman-Fried led before being convicted of fraud.】

item.title: 美国参议员桑德斯称，仿制药制造商可以低于每月 100 美元的价格销售 Ozempic
item.description: 美国参议员伯尼-桑德斯（Bernie Sanders）周二表示，他得到了主要仿制药公司的确认，他们可以以每月不到 100 美元的价格出售诺和诺德糖尿病药物 Ozempic 的仿制药。【原文：U.S. Senator Bernie Sanders said on Tuesday he received confirmation from major generic pharmaceutical companies that they could sell copycat versions of Novo Nordisk's diabetes drug Ozempic for less than $100 a month.】

item.title: 政府官员称拜登不会阻止东海岸港口可能发生的罢工
item.description: 美国总统乔-拜登（Joe Biden）的一位政府官员周二表示，如果码头工人未能在10月1日的最后期限前签订新的劳动合同，他不打算援引联邦法律来阻止东海岸和墨西哥湾的港口罢工。【原文：U.S. President Joe Biden does not intend to invoke a federal law to prevent a port strike on the East Coast and Gulf of Mexico if dockworkers fail to secure a new labor contract by an Oct. 1 deadline, an administration official said on Tuesday.】

item.title: Snap 推出新版 Spectacles 眼镜，进一步押注增强现实技术
item.description: Snap 周二宣布推出 Spectacles 增强现实眼镜的升级版，并加倍押注可增强现实世界视角的可穿戴设备将成为下一个科技前沿。【原文：Snap announced an upgraded version of its Spectacles augmented-reality glasses on Tuesday, doubling down on its bet that wearable devices to enhance the view of the real world will be one of the next frontiers in tech.】

item.title: 萨姆规则制定者认为美联储因劳动力市场担忧降息 50 个基点
item.description: 前美联储经济学家克劳迪娅-萨姆（Claudia Sahm）表示，美国经济并未陷入衰退，但劳动力市场的疲软可能会让美联储感到担忧，从而在周三将利率下调50个基点。【原文：The U.S. economy is not in a recession but labor-market weakness might worry the Federal Reserve enough to cut interest rates by 50 basis points on Wednesday, former Fed economist Claudia Sahm said.】

item.title: 特朗普的媒体股票在内幕交易限制解除前下跌
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）的媒体公司股价周二连续第二个交易日下跌，原因是美国前总统和其他内部人士出售股票的限制即将结束。【原文：Shares of Donald Trump's media company fell for a second session on Tuesday ahead of the end of restrictions on share sales by the former U.S. president and other insiders.】

item.title: 美国钢铁公司首席执行官坚信新日铁交易将 "按其价值 "完成
item.description: 美国钢铁公司首席执行官大卫-伯里特（David Burritt）周二表示，他相信新日铁对其公司 149 亿美元的竞购将 "按其价值完成"，尽管存在政治反对和国家安全审查中提出的担忧。【原文：U.S. Steel CEO David Burritt said on Tuesday he was confident Nippon Steel's $14.9 billion bid for his company would "close on its merits," despite political opposition and concerns raised in a national security review.】

item.title: 委内瑞拉寻求将 Citgo 母公司股份拍卖暂停 4 个月
item.description: 根据向美国特拉华州地区法院提交的一份文件，代表委内瑞拉的律师周二要求美国法院下令暂停拍卖总部位于休斯顿的炼油商 Citgo Petroleum 母公司的股份，为期四个月，以便向债权人付款。【原文：Lawyers representing Venezuela on Tuesday requested a four-month pause in a U.S. court-ordered auction of shares in a parent of Houston-based oil refiner Citgo Petroleum to pay creditors, according to a filing in U.S. District court, Delaware.】

item.title: 独家报道摩根大通首席执行官杰米-戴蒙将访问非洲推动增长
item.description: 摩根大通首席执行官杰米-戴蒙（Jamie Dimon）计划于 10 月中旬前往非洲，这是他七年来首次前往非洲。【原文：JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon plans to travel to Africa in mid-October in a push by the biggest U.S. lender to expand on the continent, four sources familiar with the matter told Reuters, his first trip there in seven years.】

item.title: 沃尔玛山姆会员店将从 11 月起为 10 万名员工提高时薪
item.description: 沃尔玛旗下的山姆会员店（Sam's Club）周二表示，将提高近 10 万名员工的平均时薪，作为新员工补偿计划的一部分，该计划将在假日旺季到来之前生效。【原文：Walmart-owned Sam's Club said on Tuesday it would raise average hourly wages for nearly 100,000 of its workers, as part of a new employee compensation plan that will come into effect ahead of the holiday season rush.】

item.title: 雪佛龙首席执行官抨击拜登的天然气政策，称燃料对人工智能至关重要
item.description: 雪佛龙公司首席执行官迈克尔-沃思（Michael Wirth）周二批评了美国总统乔-拜登（Joe Biden）政府所谓的 "对天然气 "行业的 "攻击"，并强调了二叠纪天然气在推动人工智能（AI）快速发展方面的关键作用。【原文：Chevron CEO Michael Wirth on Tuesday criticized U.S. President Joe Biden's administration for what he described as "attacks on the natural gas” industry and emphasized the crucial role of Permian natural gas in powering the rapid growth of artificial intelligence (AI).】

item.title: 据《华尔街日报》报道，摩根大通正与苹果洽谈接管其信用卡项目事宜
item.description: 据《华尔街日报》周二报道，摩根大通正在与苹果公司商谈从高盛集团手中接管这家科技巨头的信用卡项目。【原文：JPMorgan Chase is talking with Apple about taking over the tech giant's credit-card program from Goldman Sachs , the Wall Street Journal reported on Tuesday.】

item.title: 美国监管机构就客户同意收取透支费问题向银行发出警告
item.description: 美国消费者金融最高监管机构周二发布法律指南，称这将有助于阻止银行向未真正同意透支的客户收取透支费。【原文：The top U.S. regulator for consumer finance on Tuesday published legal guidance that it said would help stop banks from charging overdraft fees to customers who had not genuinely consented to the practice.】

item.title: Chinese insurance broker Yuanbao files for US IPO amid reviving investor appetite
item.description: Chinese insurance broker Yuanbao on Tuesday filed for an initial public offering in the United States, signaling a broader recovery in investor appetite for new listings.

item.title: 美国联邦航空局拟对 SpaceX 2023 年发射要求罚款 63.3 万美元
item.description: 美国联邦航空管理局（Federal Aviation Administration）周二表示，拟对SpaceX公司处以63.3万美元的罚款，原因是SpaceX公司涉嫌在2023年的两次发射过程中未遵守许可证要求，未获得变更许可。【原文：The Federal Aviation Administration said Tuesday it proposing to fine SpaceX $633,000 for allegedly failing to follow license requirements and not getting approval for changes during two launches in 2023.】

item.title: AT&T to pay $13 million over 2023 customer data breach
item.description: AT&T has agreed to pay $13 million to resolve an investigation over a data breach of a cloud vendor in January 2023 that impacted 8.9 million AT&T customers, the Federal Communications Commission said Tuesday.

item.title: Uber to roll out 'verified' rider badge, trip recording features in US
item.description: Uber is rolling out features that would allow its drivers to see "verified" badges on customer profiles and record trips on their smartphones instead of a dashcam, the ride-hailing firm said on Tuesday.

item.title: US business inventories rise slightly above expectations in July
item.description: U.S. business inventories increased slightly more than expected in July, suggesting that inventory investment could contribute to economic growth in the third quarter.

item.title: US regulator to propose strengthened rules for banks working with fintechs
item.description: A top U.S. banking regulator is set to propose that banks bolster recordkeeping requirements for accounts held by fintech companies on behalf of their customers, following the collapse of bank-fintech middleman Synapse Financial Technologies earlier this year, which led to the freezing of thousands of accounts.

item.title: US home builder confidence edges up as rate cut looms
item.description: U.S. home builder confidence edged up in September as mortgage rates fell, breaking four months of consecutive declines, but remained at relatively low levels as rising costs continued to impede construction.

item.title: Fed to go big on first rate cut, traders bet
item.description: Traders on Tuesday kept bets the Federal Reserve will start an expected series of interest rate cuts with a half-percentage-point move downward on Wednesday, an expectation that may itself put pressure on central bankers to deliver just that.

item.title: US manufacturing output rebounds in August
item.description: Production at U.S. factories surged in August amid a rebound in motor vehicle output, but data for the prior month was revised lower, suggesting that manufacturing continued to tread water.

item.title: US SEC fines 12 municipal advisors for recordkeeping violations
item.description: The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission on Tuesday fined 12 municipal advisors more than $1.3 million to settle civil charges that they failed to preserve electronic communications such as text messages.
